results.title: University of flying
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Men of all nationalities attend the Empire Test Pilot School at Cranfield, UK, for it is the only school of its kind in the world. Its purpose is to make men who are already experienced pilots into test pilots, for aircraft companies and Government establishments are always in need of test pilots.

results.title: Universities of Australia
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Geoffrey Bell and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An account of the growth of Australia’s universities and a survey of their contribution to our national life. The technological contribution to the nation, based on the scientific work of the universities, is stressed and the need for additional and continued support for the institutions is emphasised.

results.title: Universities at war
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Graham McInnes and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Canadian universities made many contributions to the war effort through research and applications in many disciplines including engineering, medicine, psychiatry, chemistry, agriculture and sociology. Many of these developments were also envisioned as having important peacetime applications.

results.title: Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coast Community College
results.brief_description: This series examines the history and science of astronomy. It includes superb graphics, photographs and time-lapse footage from satellites and observatories, and leading scientists in the various fields of astronomy offer clear explanations and valuable information.

results.title: Universe and I. Ep. 4. A Visit to spectrum II
results.creator_credit: Agency for Instructional Television and Kentucky Educational Television
results.brief_description:
An overview of the electromagnetic spectrum, analysing the radio-wave portion, the infra-red portion, the high-energy and where X-rays and gamma rays are found, and ultra-violet rays; set in the context of a story about the space laboratory of the future.
Suitable for lower and middle secondary level.

results.title: Universe
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A triumph of film art, creating on the screen a vast, awe-inspiring picture of the universe as it would appear to a voyager through space, this film was among the sources used by Stanley Kubrick in his 2001: A Space Odyssey. Realistic animation takes you into far regions of space, beyond the reach of the strongest telescope, past Moon, Sun, and Milky Way into galaxies yet unfathomed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB

results.title: Universal Studios tour
results.brief_description: The magic of the moving image has long captured the imagination of movie goers around the world, from the days of the silent film to the technological special effects extravaganzas of today’s action films. In this documentary, join in on a tram tour ride through the front and back lots of the famous Universal Studios which were officially opened in 1915 by film producer Carl Laemmle. See the sound stages, design studios, props warehouse in the front lot and experience the “special effects” as the tour takes an adventurous turn across a collapsing bridge, taking you head on into a flash flood, an encounter with Jaws as you pass through Amity Island and finally through the parting of the Red Sea to reach the back lot where all exterior filming takes place. It is here in the back lot you will find the street sets where many of the old b&w westerns were made, Little Europe where films such as “All Quiet on the Western Front” were produced, and some of the famous “houses” from television programs including “Leave it to Beaver”, “The Munsters”, “Marcus Welby” and the classic film “Psycho”. Also includes sets and re-enactments from “King Kong”, “Battlestar Gallactica”, “Conan” and “Jaws”, action shots of stunt performers, and excerpts from some classic films.

results.title: Universal provider
results.creator_credit: Mark Jackson, Mark Stiles and AFI [au]
results.brief_description: Universal Provider is a documentary film about a monumental building, an Australian landmark for 80 years. This film uses archival images to depict the building’s construction, interiors, employees and the manufacturing adjuncts to the Hordern empire. There is also archival film relating to imperialism and nationalism as two major supports for the Hordern image.

results.title: Universal newsreel
results.brief_description: Newsreel items: 1. Hilda blows out - hurricane leaves heavy destruction Franklin, Louisana. 2. “Thresher” found - undersea cameras pinpoint submarine - atomic sub found in Atlantic, east of Boston. 3. News in brief - California: new high speed plane makes debut from Edwards Air Force base. 4. Sports - Ohio: Davis Cup. Chuck McKinely v Roy Emerson. Emerson wins.
